title: A Norwegian Battery Maker Is Moving To The U.S. To Tap Federal Incentives
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project, named Giga America, is located in Coweta County, Georgia, southwest of Atlanta, United States.

Capacity:
- The Georgia plant is planned to have the capacity to produce 34 gigawatt hours of batteries annually when it opens in a few years.

Investment amounts:
- The company is building Giga America, a $2.5 billion battery plant in Georgia.

Project progress:
- Freyr is currently building the Giga America battery plant in Georgia, with plans for it to open in a few years. The company has also opened a small-scale factory line in Mo I Rana, Norway, earlier this year to start making pouch-type "SemiSolid" lithium-ion cells.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as the company is currently constructing the Giga America battery plant in Georgia.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cell fabrication, as it will produce cells for use in stationary energy storage systems, electric vehicles, and marine products.

title: FREYR Battery Announces Plans for U.S. Gigafactory in Georgia
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project, Giga America, is located in Coweta County, Georgia, United States.

Capacity:
- The initial battery cell production module is planned to have a capacity of approximately 34 GWh. 

Investment amounts:
- The preliminary estimated capital investment for the initial battery cell production module is $1.7 billion. 
- The total capital investments are expected to exceed $2.6 billion by 2029.
- The State of Georgia and Coweta County are providing strong financial incentives for the project. 
- FREYR intends to apply for packages from the U.S. Department of Energy, potentially including grants and/or direct loans.

Project progress:
- The project is expected to be developed in multiple phases, with detailed plant engineering planned in the coming months.
- The company is evaluating additional value accretive upstream and downstream modules, as well as a second cell production phase.
- The Giga America project is expected to be one of the largest battery cell manufacturing developments globally upon completion of all construction phases.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with plans for the development of a battery cell production module and potential additional modules.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cell fabrication, as it is planned to produce battery cells using the next-generation SemiSolid™ Lithium-Ion Battery Technology platform developed by 24M Technologies Inc.

Note: The information provided is based on the data extracted from the articles related to the project.
